articles.description: Every year, Music on the Half Shell (MOTHS) brings in a selection of artists from far and wide to provide Roseburg with nights of live music. However, MOTHS Vice President Lani Kimoto said the heart of the program doesn't come…
articles.title: Music on the Half Shell kicks off by bringing the bayou to the Umpqua with The Revelers

articles.author: ERICA REYNOLDS The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — A 17-year-old male was transported to Mercy Medical Center on Tuesday evening after being stabbed multiple times.
articles.title: Local juvenile stabbed, second detained

articles.description: SOUTH DOUGLAS COUNTY — Free summer meal distribution is underway in the South Umpqua School District.
articles.title: Free summer meal distribution underway for South Umpqua youth

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: GLIDE — Along with salmon and pine trees, Sasquatch is arguably one of the most iconic symbols of the Pacific Northwest. Fortunately for Oregonians obsessed with the local legend, the community of Glide will be host to the Glide Sasquatch…
articles.title: Glide to celebrate crytpids, country and community 2025 Glide Sasquatch Festival

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: OAKLAND — With its well-preserved downtown area and status as the first city to be placed on the Oregon historic register, Oakland is a town that’s proud of its history. In that spirit, actors from the area are putting together…
articles.title: Local actors to bring laughs, cheers and boos with this year's Oakland Melodrama

articles.author: Maggie Dapp The News-Review
articles.description: Creative agency Anvil Northwest was re-awarded the contract to be the city of Roseburg’s destination marketing organization (DMO) on June 9 by unanimous vote, following a tumultuous selection process.
articles.title: Roseburg re-awards marketing contract to Anvil Northwest, creates oversight committee

articles.author: Maggie Dapp The News-Review
articles.description: SUTHERLIN — Instead of Jimmy Hendrix and muddy fields, attendees can expect furry friends and sunshine at this year’s Umpqua Woofstock Festival.
articles.title: Gear up for a paw-sitive time at Umpqua Woofstock Festival

articles.author: ERICA REYNOLDS The News-Review
articles.description: Winchester — Douglas Timber Operators will hold its no host breakfast meeting at 8 a.m. June 26. Held at The Loft at Del Rey Cafe, 5669 NE Stephens St., Winchester, Con-Vey CEO Dave Larecy will present on wood production automation…
articles.title: DTO no host breakfast scheduled for June 26

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: A sea of signs and flags. Flashes of red, white and blue waving in the air. Cars honking. Joyful cheers followed by roaring expletives. Country music playing on portable speakers in the distance. Faces young and old peering out from…
articles.title: Nationwide "No Kings" protest draws hundreds to the streets in Roseburg

articles.author: Maggie Dapp The News-Review
articles.description: When the Sutherlin Bi-Mart’s pharmacy closed in 2021, Sutherlin Drug became the only place to fill a prescription for miles.

articles.description: DOUGLAS COUNTY — The Umpqua National Forest has announced some temporary adjustments this week to the schedule of the North Umpqua Ranger Station.

articles.description: ROSEBURG — Roseburg Fire Department, Central Douglas Fire & Rescue and Cow Creek Tribal Fire Management will be actively engaging in wildland fire training and exercises on Reservoir Hill in Roseburg on June 23, 25 and 27.
articles.title: City announces wildland fire training on Reservoir Hill

articles.author: Maggie Dapp The News-Review
articles.description: FLORENCE — As agencies and organizations see state and federal funding slashed nationwide, child advocacy organization Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) has looked towards private grants amidst the uncertainty, according to CASA of Douglas County Executive Director Angela Gross.
articles.title: 10 Douglas County organizations boosted by Three Rivers Foundation grants

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: For many in Oregon, fall means fishing season as anglers take to the water with hopes of reeling in flavorful wild-caught fall chinook salmon. The ODFW is expecting a solid fishing season in most coastal rivers, but one in particular…
articles.title: Troubled waters: Wild fall chinook salmon fishing is facing new restrictions

articles.author: Maggie Dapp The News-Review
articles.description: RIDDLE — As Brandy Blankenship walked up a dusty dirt slope, surveying the land that will make her a first-time homeowner, she didn’t stop smiling.
articles.title: Event kicks off Habitat for Humanity housing project in Riddle

articles.author: Brittany Arnold For The News-Review
articles.description: As summer break begins, parents throughout Douglas County are looking for opportunities to keep their children active, safe and socially engaged. Research shows that many children experience a significant decline in both academic skills and physical activity during the summer…
articles.title: YMCA of Douglas County launches summer programs

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: GLIDE — The Bureau of Land Management, Roseburg District, has announced a 122-acre prescribed burn within the North Umpqua Management Area, approximately 6 miles west of Glide off North Bank Road.

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Oregon Department of Emergency Management (OEM) has announced the delivery of advanced water rescue equipment to two Oregon communities as part of the State Preparedness and Incident Response Equipment grant program.
articles.title: Central Douglas received high-tech water rescue equipment

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A teen was stabbed during a fight at Stewart Park on June 17. Roseburg Police say a 15-year-old allegedly stabbed a 17-year-old, who was hospitalized with non-life-threatening injuries. The suspect was taken into custody. The investigation is ongoing.
articles.title: Teen Stabbing at Stewart Park Under Investigation
